author: ovid11
content: Hello everyone, it's great to meet you all! Could someone please help me understand where I can find the MEV Block Reward for each slot, either through an API or some other method? I looked into the beaconcha.in API but couldn't find what I needed. Thanks so much!

content: you could try checking each relay's website for delivered payloads, e.g. https://boost-relay.flashbots.net

content: there is a relay data API, if you in particular want something machine-readable

author: ovid11
content: Thanks a lot, ralexstokes! I'll check this out. I did find the data I was looking for through Beaconcha.in's block execution function, but I really appreciate your response.

author: caiosa2339
content: Guys, a question: the EIP-6780 is now being used because of Dencun. I'd like to know whether other EVM chains all get the same functionality right away? I mean, do BSC, Polygon, etc, all adhere to how the selfdestruct opcode now currently works or do they have the old functionality (deleting account data) for a while?

author: _shemnon
content: If they adopt the cancun spec, they should adopt all it's behaviors unless there is a good reason not to.  One important canary is to see if they advertise support for TSTORE/TLOAD or if they warn against it's use.  But each chain may also support subsets (for example not supporting blobs), so it is important to check each L2's docs.
